title: Sell Hakushu Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Hakushu Whisky | 12, 18, 25 Year & Limited Editions | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your Hakushu whisky for a direct cash offer. We buy Hakushu 12, 18, 25, and limited releases like the Peated Malt series.
heroSubhead: Direct purchase of Hakushu 12, 18, 25, and rare limited editions.
introParagraph: Hakushu, known as the 'forest distillery', produces some of the most sought-after peated Japanese whiskies. We purchase all age statements and limited releases.
photoChecklist: Front label clearly showing age statement
conditionFactors: Original Box: Presence of the green carton significantly affects value
Import Labels: US vs Japanese domestic releases vary in price
Fading: Green bottles hide fill level, use a light test
Capsule: Check for cracks in the foil on older 18/25 releases
pricingFactors: Age Statement: 25 Year commands a massive premium over 18
Discontinued Label: 'Pure Malt' vs 'Single Malt' labeling
Limited Edition: Peated Malt 2013/2012 editions are highly valued
Market Demand: High global demand for age-statement Hakushu

faqs.question: Do you buy the 12 Year Old?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy Hakushu 12 Year Old, especially older bottlings.

faqs.question: What is the difference between Pure Malt and Single Malt?
faqs.answer: Older bottlings were labeled 'Pure Malt'. These are often more valuable to collectors than the modern 'Single Malt' labels.

faqs.question: Do I need the box?
faqs.answer: For the 18 and 25 Year, the box is critical for full value. For the 12 Year, it is less important.

faqs.question: Can I sell the 'Distiller's Reserve'?
faqs.answer: Yes, though the offer will be lower than age-statement bottles as it is a NAS (No Age Statement) release.

faqs.question: How do I check the fill level on the green bottle?
faqs.answer: Hold a flashlight behind the bottle neck. We need to see the liquid line.

faqs.question: Do you buy airport editions?
faqs.answer: Yes, we buy travel retail exclusives like the Hakushu 18 Limited Edition.
